author: Anjum Anand
method: Place the jaggery into a small pan and heat gently, stirring frequently, until melted and smooth. Add the walnut halves and stir to coat. Spread the walnut halves onto a sheet of baking paper or an oiled plate, working quickly before the jaggery starts to harden - if it does, return to the heat for a few seconds until melted again. Allow to cool completely, then break into pieces. When cold, store in an airtight container until needed. Serve as a snack or sprinkled over desserts and yoghurts.
ingredients: 100g/3Â½oz jaggery (available in Asian stores and some supermarkets), chopped or pounded into smallish pieces,  50g/2oz walnut halves, shells removed
